“Going home again is like learning how to land when you already know how to fly. You think soaring through the atmosphere is scary? Try coming back down to earth.” – Carol Danvers

Art by Julián Totino Tedesco

summary: The Monica Rambeau Captain Marvel had a great powerset, the ability to change to any kind of energy, as illustrated here by John...
caption:
The Monica Rambeau Captain Marvel had a great powerset, the ability to change to any kind of energy, as illustrated here by John Byrne, who was one of Marvel’s more science and scifi minded creators.

Though she had a great costume, powerset, and personality, she was widely disliked in her time in Avengers because she was seen, rightly or wrongly, as a “pet character” of writer Roger Stern (much like how Mantis was Steve Englehart’s), who was “skipped to the head of the line,” “didn’t pay her dues,” and even became leader of the Avengers. Stern left Avengers because he refused to write her out the way editorial requested, and the first thing Simonson did when Stern left was to depower Monica with…surprising vindictiveness. 

After Roger Stern left Avengers, she was never again an A-list Marvel character, but in her time in Avengers, she was enough of a “big deal” to make it to the cover of the Marvel Universe Roleplaying Game along with Spider Man and Captain America (a roleplaying game co-written and designed, incidentally, by a young Warren Spector, best known for the game Deux Ex). She also did something very cool in Busiek and Perez’s Avengers/JLA event in 2003, where she actually transformed into Green Lantern’s emerald energy when battling him.

Stern left Avengers because he refused to write her out the way editorial requested, and the first thing Simonson did when Stern left was to depower Monica with…surprising vindictiveness.

She also did something very cool in Busiek and Perez’s Avengers/JLA event in 2003, where she actually transformed into Green Lantern’s emerald energy when battling him.

Though she had a great costume, powerset, and personality, she was widely disliked in her time in Avengers because she was seen, rightly or wrongly, as a “pet character” of writer Roger Stern (much like how Mantis was Steve Englehart’s), who was “skipped to the head of the line,” “didn’t pay her dues,” and even became leader of the Avengers. Stern left Avengers because he refused to write her out the way editorial requested, and the first thing Simonson did when Stern left was to depower Monica with…surprising vindictiveness. 

After Roger Stern left Avengers, she was never again an A-list Marvel character, but in her time in Avengers, she was enough of a “big deal” to make it to the cover of the Marvel Universe Roleplaying Game along with Spider Man and Captain America (a roleplaying game co-written and designed, incidentally, by a young Warren Spector, best known for the game Deux Ex). She also did something very cool in Busiek and Perez’s Avengers/JLA event in 2003, where she actually transformed into Green Lantern’s emerald energy when battling him.

The Monica Rambeau Captain Marvel had a great powerset, the ability to change to any kind of energy, as illustrated here by John Byrne, who was one of Marvel’s more science and scifi minded creators.

Though she had a great costume, powerset, and personality, she was widely disliked in her time in Avengers because she was seen, rightly or wrongly, as a “pet character” of writer Roger Stern (much like how Mantis was Steve Englehart’s), who was “skipped to the head of the line,” “didn’t pay her dues,” and even became leader of the Avengers. Stern left Avengers because he refused to write her out the way editorial requested, and the first thing Simonson did when Stern left was to depower Monica with…surprising vindictiveness. 

After Roger Stern left Avengers, she was never again an A-list Marvel character, but in her time in Avengers, she was enough of a “big deal” to make it to the cover of the Marvel Universe Roleplaying Game along with Spider Man and Captain America (a roleplaying game co-written and designed, incidentally, by a young Warren Spector, best known for the game Deux Ex). She also did something very cool in Busiek and Perez’s Avengers/JLA event in 2003, where she actually transformed into Green Lantern’s emerald energy when battling him.

THE LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL #5 (of 5)

  • MARGARET STOHL (W) • CARLOS PACHECO & MARGUERITE SAUVAGE (A)
  • Cover by JULIAN TOTINO TEDESCO
  • VARIANT COVER BY KAARE ANDREWS

summary: Carol Danvers: COULSON! Oh my god, it's been years since I've seen you! Last time I saw you, you were just starting out in...
body:
Carol Danvers: COULSON! Oh my god, it's been years since I've seen you! Last time I saw you, you were just starting out in SHIELD. What have you been up to lately?
Phil Coulson: Oh, not much. Well, I died but then got resurrected by Nick Fury. SHIELD then turned out to be HYDRA. I became director but went crazy for a bit. Then this Inhuman outbreak happened. Then I fell in love with someone named Rosalind Price, who got shot by one of my former agents who turned out to be a HYDRA agent. I killed him, then the founder of HYDRA possessed his body and came to Earth to destroy everything. Then after we dealt with him, I met Ghost Rider, who led us to this book of supernatural power called the Darkhold. A scientist named Holden Radcliffe used it to make Life Model Decoys, which then went crazy. And then I got kidnapped and put into something called the Framework, which was this digital recreation of the entire world, minus our biggest regrets. Then I made a deal with the devil to destroy the leader of the Life Model Decoys. And then after, I got taken to the future, where I learned the world was destroyed sometime in the past. When we got back to the past, we learned that the world was destroyed by Glenn Talbot, who absorbed a large amount of gravitonium to become Graviton. My daughter figure, Daisy, had to kill him to save the world. Also, I have a few days to live since the deal I made with the devil was at the cost of my own life.
Carol Danvers: ...
Phil Coulson: Oh, and I got together with Melinda May.

dialogue.name: Carol Danvers
dialogue.label: Carol Danvers:
dialogue.phrase: COULSON! Oh my god, it's been years since I've seen you! Last time I saw you, you were just starting out in SHIELD. What have you been up to lately?

dialogue.name: Phil Coulson
dialogue.label: Phil Coulson:
dialogue.phrase: Oh, not much. Well, I died but then got resurrected by Nick Fury. SHIELD then turned out to be HYDRA. I became director but went crazy for a bit. Then this Inhuman outbreak happened. Then I fell in love with someone named Rosalind Price, who got shot by one of my former agents who turned out to be a HYDRA agent. I killed him, then the founder of HYDRA possessed his body and came to Earth to destroy everything. Then after we dealt with him, I met Ghost Rider, who led us to this book of supernatural power called the Darkhold. A scientist named Holden Radcliffe used it to make Life Model Decoys, which then went crazy. And then I got kidnapped and put into something called the Framework, which was this digital recreation of the entire world, minus our biggest regrets. Then I made a deal with the devil to destroy the leader of the Life Model Decoys. And then after, I got taken to the future, where I learned the world was destroyed sometime in the past. When we got back to the past, we learned that the world was destroyed by Glenn Talbot, who absorbed a large amount of gravitonium to become Graviton. My daughter figure, Daisy, had to kill him to save the world. Also, I have a few days to live since the deal I made with the devil was at the cost of my own life.

dialogue.name: Phil Coulson
dialogue.label: Phil Coulson:
dialogue.phrase: Oh, and I got together with Melinda May.
